name: Excess Information Rate (Ingress)
title: EIR-I
definition: Identifies the average rate (bits per second) up to which service frames may be delivered but will not be guaranteed per the provider’s service level specification.

validEntry.description: Valid EIR expressed as a numeric value followed by “K”, “M” or
“G” representing Kilobits, Megabits or Gigabits per second

usageNotes: Optional when the associated LREF field is populated and the LOSACT field is not “D”, otherwise prohibited.
fieldNotes: EIR-I is not tracked for frame loss by the MEF Ethernet OAM Protocol, unlike CIR.
